event_name: Moat Makers Masterclass with Kush Mishra
event_summary: Kush Mishra's masterclass teaches building tech businesses with strong technical moats, covering ideation frameworks, real-world examples (IoT, AI), and team building.  Ideal for aspiring founders, product leaders, and innovators seeking actionable strategies for success in competitive markets.
full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka
event_description:
â€‹Moat Makers Masterclass with Kush Mishra

â€‹Event Description:
Unlock the secrets to building world-class technology businesses with defensible, deep technical moats in this hands-on masterclass led by Kush Mishra. Dive into proven frameworks for ideating in cutting-edge technology spaces and learn how to transform breakthrough ideas into sustainable ventures. Whether you're an aspiring founder, product leader, or innovator, this session will equip you with actionable strategies to identify unique opportunities, leverage advanced technologies, and outpace the competition in rapidly evolving markets.

â€‹Key Topics:

â€‹How to create a business with a deep technical moat

â€‹Frameworks and mindsets for ideating in advanced technology domains

â€‹Real-world examples from IoT, AI, and industrial automation

â€‹Building and scaling teams for innovation

â€‹Ideation to Impact: Innovating at the Edge of AI and Hardware

â€‹Connected Ecosystems: Wearables, Smart Homes, and Beyond

â€‹AI-Driven Health Insights: The Future of Personalized Wellness

â€‹Speaker Profile: Kush Mishra

â€‹Kush Mishra is a seasoned technology leader, entrepreneur, and angel investor with over 14 years of experience driving innovation in deep-tech, IoT, AI, and product development. Currently, he is a Member at South Park Commons, an exclusive community of builders and founders supporting early-stage startups on their â€œ-1 to 0â€ journey since September 2024.

â€‹Prior to this, Kush served as Chief Product Officer (Devices) & VP Technology at Noise (Nov 2022 â€“ Apr 2024), where he led the development of cutting-edge wearable devices, mobile apps, and hardware innovation, including the successful launch of products like the Luna Ring. His leadership contributed to Noiseâ€™s technology innovation and go-to-market strategies.

â€‹Before Noise, Kush was CTO & COO at SenRa, where he spearheaded the deployment of public LoRaWAN networks and end-to-end IoT solutions for smart cities and industrial applications. He is also the founder of InterNext Engineering, a pioneer in industrial IoT and AI-driven automation.

â€‹An alumnus of IIT Roorkee and the Indian School of Business (ISB), Kush holds multiple patents and has contributed extensively to embedded systems, AI, and product innovation. He is a recognized thought leader and speaker on building deep technical moats and ideation in emerging technology spaces.

event_name: From Seed to Scale: Navigating the Challenges of Hypergrowth in SaaS
event_summary: The sixth RevOps Chronicles event, "From Seed to Scale," focuses on navigating hypergrowth challenges in SaaS.  Attendees will learn scalable RevOps strategies, talent acquisition tactics, and tech stack evolution from industry leaders who've achieved market dominance.  Ideal for SaaS founders, RevOps leaders, and anyone in a growth-focused role.
full_address: BHIVE Workspace HSR 27th Main, L-148, ITI Layout, Sector 6, HSR Layout, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560102, India
event_description:
â€‹ğŸ”¥ RevOps Chronicles: The Saga Continues! ğŸ”¥

â€‹From Seed to Scale: Navigating the Challenges of Hypergrowth in SaaS

â€‹Get ready, RevOps trailblazers! We're absolutely buzzing to announce the SIXTH incredible installment of RevOps Chronicles! That's right â€“ five events down, each one a resounding success, packed with actionable insights, vibrant discussions, and a community that's truly transforming the RevOps landscape. We've hit every one out of the park, and the energy only keeps growing!

â€‹Why have we been flying so high? Because we listen, we learn, and we deliver content that's directly relevant to your challenges. From dissecting the latest tech stacks to optimizing your GTM strategies, we've consistently brought you the brightest minds and the most impactful conversations. Each event has been a testament to the power of a connected RevOps community, and the feedback has been nothing short of phenomenal!

â€‹Now, buckle up, because for our sixth event, we're diving deep into a topic that keeps every SaaS leader up at night: HYPERGROWTH!

â€‹Are You Ready to Soar?

â€‹If you're a SaaS professional wrestling with the glorious chaos of rapid expansion, then this event is tailor-made for you! We're talking to:

â€‹SaaS Founders & CEOs: Ready to navigate the scaling challenges without losing your vision?

â€‹Revenue Operations Leaders: Looking to build robust systems that support exponential growth?

â€‹Sales & Marketing VPs: Eager to align your strategies for maximum impact during hypergrowth?

â€‹Customer Success Executives: Committed to retaining and expanding your customer base as you scale?

event_description:
â€‹CustomerConnect: The AI Agents Revolution in Support

â€‹Event Details:

â€‹Date: Tuesday, July 15, 2025

â€‹Time: 9:00 AM â€“ 9:00 PM IST (12-hour hackathon)

â€‹Location: A major co-working space, tech hub, or university campus in Bengaluru (e.g., WeWork, NASSCOM Startup Warehouse, IIIT-B, RVCE Auditorium)

â€‹Overview:

â€‹One-day hackathon to design, build, and demo a functional AI agent for customer support

â€‹Rapid iteration using pre-trained LLMs and AI agent frameworks

â€‹Focused on solving real-world pain points in customer service

â€‹Why Participate?

â€‹Fast-paced innovation with rapid prototyping

â€‹Hands-on learning with AI agent development

â€‹Networking with developers, designers, and experts

â€‹Real-world impact through practical solutions

â€‹Improve problem-solving, teamwork, and presentation skills

â€‹Who Can Participate?

â€‹Developers (backend/frontend) familiar with Python, JavaScript, APIs

â€‹AI/ML enthusiasts with LLM and NLP exposure

â€‹UX/UI designers focused on intuitive design

â€‹Customer service professionals with domain insights

â€‹Students eager to apply knowledge and learn

â€‹Anyone passionate about AI-driven problem solving

â€‹Team Info:

â€‹Team Size: 1â€“4 members

â€‹Individuals can join or form teams during the event

â€‹Payment Link

â€‹https://payments.cashfree.com/forms/aiagenthackathon

â€‹Challenge Focus Areas (Choose One):

â€‹Smart FAQ & Intent Routing Agent:

â€‹Answer FAQs from a knowledge base

â€‹Route unanswered queries to relevant departments

â€‹Input: Text/URL of FAQ document

â€‹Metric: Accuracy in answering and routing

â€‹Sentiment-Aware Escalation Agent:

â€‹Detect negative sentiment in customer messages

â€‹Trigger escalation or human intervention

â€‹Input: Sample chat transcripts

â€‹Metric: Sentiment detection accuracy and timely escalation

â€‹Order Status & Tracking Agent:

â€‹Answer questions like â€œWhere is my order?â€

â€‹Input: Dummy order data (JSON/CSV)

â€‹Metric: Correct retrieval of order info

â€‹Complaint Categorization Agent:

â€‹Categorize customer complaints into predefined categories

â€‹Summarize key issue

â€‹Input: Complaint texts/emails

â€‹Metric: Categorization and summary accuracy

â€‹Technology & Resources:

â€‹Languages/Platforms: Python (preferred), JavaScript/Node.js

â€‹AI Agent Frameworks: LangChain, AutoGen, Microsoft Semantic Kernel, CrewAI

â€‹LLMs: GPT-3.5, GPT-4o, Google Gemini, Llama.cpp (for local setup)

â€‹Development Tools: GitHub, VS Code, Jupyter

â€‹Data Handling: SQLite, JSON, Pandas

â€‹UI Options: Streamlit, Gradio, Flask, React, CLI

â€‹Mentorship: On-site AI/ML engineers and customer service experts

â€‹Pre-event Prep: Starter kit with docs, datasets, and code templates

â€‹Schedule:

â€‹9:00 AM â€“ 9:30 AM: Registration & Welcome Coffee

â€‹9:30 AM â€“ 10:00 AM: Kick-off, challenge overview, Q&A, team formation

â€‹10:00 AM â€“ 10:30 AM: Ideation and planning

â€‹10:30 AM â€“ 6:30 PM: Hacking session (core build time)

â€‹1:00 PM â€“ 2:00 PM: Lunch break (provided)

â€‹4:00 PM â€“ 4:30 PM: Snacks and coffee

â€‹4:30 PM â€“ 6:30 PM: Finalize prototypes and demo prep

â€‹6:30 PM â€“ 7:30 PM: Rapid-fire team demos (3 min presentation + 2 min Q&A)

â€‹7:30 PM â€“ 9:00 PM: Judging, networking, and winner announcement

â€‹Judging Criteria:

â€‹Functionality (40%) â€“ Working solution, solves chosen problem

â€‹Innovation & Approach (25%) â€“ Creative, smart use of AI agents

â€‹Impact (20%) â€“ Value and real-world relevance

â€‹Presentation & Demo (15%) â€“ Clear communication and effective demo

â€‹Prizes:

â€‹1st Prize: INR 10,000 + Certificates + Recognition

â€‹2nd Prize: INR 5,000 + Certificates

â€‹3rd Prize: INR 2,500 + Certificates

event_name: AMD AI SPRINT: HACKATHON & WORKSHOP SERIES- Bengaluru, INDIA
event_summary: AMD's Bengaluru AI Sprint is a 2-day hackathon and workshop series for experienced AI developers (1+ year LLM experience) featuring AMD MI300X GPUs and expert instruction from AMD, Hugging Face, and Meta.  Participants compete for â‚¹5 Lakh in prizes by building AI agents in two tracks: an adversarial question-answering game and an intelligent scheduling assistant.  This event is NOT for beginners.
full_address: Indian Institute of Science (Bengaluru), CV Raman Rd, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560012, India
presented_by_name: AMD AI Sprint Hackathon & Workshop Series
event_description:
â€‹Please Read before Registering:
â€‹This hackathon is not beginner-friendly. We are specifically looking for developers with experience and a proven track record in the following areas:

â€‹Proficiency in Python and expertise with ML libraries such as PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, or LangChain.

â€‹Prior experience (minimum 1 year) with training, fine-tuning, or prompting LLMs (e.g., Qwen, LLaMA, Mistral, or GPT-based models).

â€‹Familiarity with agentic workflows, prompt engineering, or RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)pipelines.

â€‹Ability to work with Linux-based remote GPU instances or cloud environments.

â€‹IMPORTANT NOTE:

â€‹Please do not contact the event hosts for approval updates. All application approvals will be communicated only via Luma.

â€‹We are currently reviewing a high volume of applications. Thank you for your patience!

â€‹AMD is NOT responsible for sponsoring travel or accommodation. If your application is approved, it will be your responsibility to make your own travel and stay arrangements.

â€‹Please do NOT contact IISc, Bengaluru about event approval.

â€‹Why Attend?

â€‹â€‹Join Indiaâ€™s leading AI engineers, researchers, and enthusiasts in Mumbai for a 2-day hands-on workshops and hackathons powered by AMDâ€™s MI300X GPUs. Whether you're a student, AI expert, or just starting your journey in machine learning, this is your chance to:

â€‹Build AI agents using models like Qwen and Llama through a browser-based workflow â€“ no prior experience needed

â€‹Fine-tune pre-trained models with tools like torchtune and Unsloth to specialize them for real-world tasks

â€‹Work directly on AMDâ€™s cutting-edge MI300X GPUs with guidance from AMD experts

â€‹Learn from engineers at AMD, Hugging Face, Meta & more

â€‹Win exciting prizes in the hackathons

â€‹Seats are limited â€“ register early to secure your spot in Bengaluru!

â€‹Agenda:

â€‹â€‹Day 1:

â€‹â€‹9:30 AM â€“ Doors Open

â€‹â€‹10:00 AM â€“ Opening Talk by AMD on "Whatâ€™s New with AMDâ€™s Developer Initiatives?"

â€‹â€‹10:15 AM â€“ Hackathon/Competition Introduction

â€‹â€‹10:30 AM â€“ Workshop 1: Developing MCP Agents with AMD GPUs.

â€‹â€‹11:15 AM - 11:30 AM Breakâ€“ Workshop 2: Finetuning AI models using Torchtune and other libraries.

â€‹â€‹12:15 PM â€“ Lunch + Networking + Hackathon/ Competition Team Formation if not done already

â€‹â€‹1:00 PM â€“ Hackathon/Competition Kickoff+ Overview on Rules, Resources & Support

â€‹â€‹6:00 PM â€“ Dinner & Networking

â€‹â€‹Day 2

â€‹â€‹8:00 AM â€“ Doors Open + Breakfast Networking

â€‹â€‹8:45 AM â€“ Partner Talk: Hugging Face- {Details Coming soon}

â€‹â€‹9:00 AM â€“ 2:00 PM â€“ Hackathon/Competition Continue

â€‹â€‹12:00 PM â€“ 1:00 PM â€“ Lunch

â€‹2:00 PM - Submission Deadline

â€‹â€‹2:00 PM â€“ 4:00 PM - Evaluation

â€‹3:00 PM - Research Talk: Prof. Prathosh AP, IISc Bangalore

â€‹â€‹4:00 PM â€“ 5:00 PM â€“ Optional Top Team Presentations (5 min each)

â€‹â€‹5:30 PM â€“ 8:00 PM â€“ Awards + Happy Hour

â€‹Workshop Details:
â€‹Building AI Agents on AMD GPUs

â€‹This hands-on workshop teaches you how to set up AI models and build intelligent agents (like chatbots or task-automation tools) using AMD MI300X GPUs. Youâ€™ll learn from AMD experts on how open-source models like Qwen and Llama through a browser-based workflow. No prior experience needed!

â€‹ Fine-Tuning AI Models

â€‹This second beginner-level workshop focuses on fine-tuning pre-trained AI models to make them smarter or more specific to a task (like better in answering questions or generating images). Youâ€™ll use AMD GPUs, torchtune, and other open-source tools like Unsloth, with guidance from AMD engineers.

â€‹Hackathon / Competition Details

â€‹A total of 5 Lakh in Prize money.

â€‹Track 1: AMD AI Premier League (AAIPL)

â€‹A head-to-head AI competition where teams of up to 3 developers build two intelligent language model based agents:

â€‹Q-agent: Generates valid, challenging multiple choice questions belonging to a given domain.

â€‹A-agent: Attempts to answer questions posed by the opposing teamâ€™s Q-agent.

â€‹Goal: Create a question generator that can pose the most difficult yet correct questions while ensuring your answerer can accurately answer as many of them.

â€‹Format:

â€‹Matches are played between pairs of teams where one team's Q-agent generates a set of questions to which A-agent of the opposing team responds and vice-versa.

â€‹Winning teams advance to the next stage.

â€‹Resources Provided:

â€‹1 MI300 GPU for 24 hours

â€‹Sample code for prompt tuning, reinforcement learning, and fine-tuning

â€‹Deliverables:

â€‹Final working solution

â€‹PowerPoint summarizing techniques used

â€‹Track 2: Agentic AI Scheduling Assistant

â€‹Problem: Scheduling meetings across time zones is inefficient and requires multiple back-and-forth messages. Existing tools lack intelligent conflict resolution.

â€‹Goal: Build an AI-powered scheduling assistant using Agentic AI that automates meeting coordination by

â€‹Scanning participant calendars to find optimal meeting slots

â€‹Negotiating conflicts with other participant agents

â€‹Sending polite reschedule requests

â€‹Instantly confirming meetings or proposing alternative times

â€‹Expectation: A seamless, intelligent assistant that minimizes manual effort in scheduling.

â€‹Resources Provided:

â€‹1 MI300 GPU for 24 hours

â€‹Example application and dummy calendar events

full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka
event_description:
â€‹Join us for a deep dive into Agentic AI and Application-to-Application (A2A) integration, exploring how these technologies are redefining enterprise automation and multi-agent collaboration. This two-session event combines technical insights, real-world use cases, and hands-on demos to empower developers and AI practitioners.

â€‹Session 1: Agentic AI â€“ Autonomous Systems in Action

â€‹Session 2: MCP & A2A â€“ The Backbone of Connected AI

â€‹Dive into the protocols powering seamless integration:

â€‹Model Context Protocol (MCP):

â€‹A universal interface for AI agents to access tools, APIs, and data dynamically.

â€‹Enables plug-and-play connectivity, eliminating custom integration work.

â€‹A2A Integration:

â€‹Traditional A2A: SAPâ€™s approach to automating data exchange between internal systems (CRM, ERP) using middleware like Integration Builder.

â€‹Modern A2A: Googleâ€™s open-source Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol, enabling cross-framework agent communication via tasks, messages, and streaming.

event_name: Databricks DevConnect | Bengaluru, IN
event_summary: Databricks DevConnect Bengaluru (Oct 16th) offers data engineers an immersive evening of technical sessions on Databricks' latest advancements in data engineering, AI, and analytics, including Unity Catalog and Databricks Assistant. full_address: Databricks India Pvt Ltd, XPP3+VFV, Ashraya Layout, Garudachar Palya, Mahadevapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560048, India
event_description:
â€‹ğŸ”ŠğŸŒŸ Calling all data engineersğŸŒŸğŸ”Š
â€‹â€‹Join us for Databricks DevConnect on Thursday, October 16 from 5:00pm - 9:00pm IST at the Databricks Bengaluru office!

â€‹Databricks DevConnect is a technical meetup designed for data engineers to experience an immersive evening of insights, collaborative learning, and community â€“ hosted by the Databricks Developer Relations team. Bringing together data enthusiasts and innovators, weâ€™ll explore the latest advancements in Databricks data engineering, AI, and analytics. Youâ€™ll have the chance to dive deep into technical discussions, share real-world experiences, and discover new ways to leverage Databricksâ€™s technologies. Whether youâ€™re a seasoned data engineer or just starting your journey, this event is designed to spark creativity and foster growth in our community. Letâ€™s connect, learn, and push the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible with data â€“ together!

â€‹â€‹Why You Can't Miss This Event:

â€‹â€‹ğŸ”“ Unlock the Power of Databricks: Discover how our unified platform can power your data engineering and AI initiatives.

â€‹â€‹ğŸ§  Learn from Experts: Â Gain actionable insights from Databricks Engineers, Product Managers, DevRel, and MVPs.

â€‹â€‹ğŸ’» Engaging Technical Sessions: Deepen technical expertise through interactive demos of the Databricks platform, and tools.

â€‹â€‹ğŸ¤ Network with the Community: Connect and build relationships with peers, MVPs, Databricks product managers, developer advocates, and engineers.

â€‹ğŸ‘• Access to exclusive content and goodies: Swag will be raffled off throughout the event and attendees will get access to hands-on training and guided labs through Databricks Academy Labs post event!

â€‹â€‹AGENDA

â€‹â€‹5:00 PM: Registration & MinglingÂ 

â€‹6:00 PM: Welcome Remarks by:

â€‹â€‹Holly Smith, Staff Developer Advocate

â€‹â€‹6:15 PM â¡ï¸ Session #1: The Unified Lakehouse: Format Interoperability and transparent Governance with Unity Catalog

â€‹â€‹6:45 PM â¡ï¸ Session #2: End-to-End Development with Databricks Assistant: From Data Discovery to Production

â€‹7:15 PM â¡ï¸ Session #3: Turning the Tables on Tuning your Tables

â€‹â€‹7:55 PM: Closing Remarks by:

â€‹â€‹8:00 PM: Networking Reception

â€‹â€‹9:00 PM: Good night

â€‹â€‹SESSION DESCRIPTIONS

â€‹â€‹The Unified Lakehouse: Format Interoperability and transparent Governance with Unity Catalog: This technical session demonstrates how Databricks' Unity Catalog simplifies data integration and governance across the lakehouse, regardless of data format. Learn how Unity Catalog enables seamless connectivity to diverse data sources, providing full format interoperability, while empowering data engineers to implement robust governance and security measures. We will delve into leveraging open standards for data management, implementing fine-grained access controls, utilizing advanced lineage tracking, and establishing secure collaboration workflows. Discover how to manage data assets effectively, ensure compliance with data regulations, and architect a well-governed, secure lakehouse that fosters innovation and maintains data integrity.

â€‹â€‹End-to-End Development with Databricks Assistant: From Data Discovery to Production: In this technical deep dive, weâ€™ll explore how developers can leverage the Databricks Assistant to streamline workflows across the entire development lifecycleâ€”from data discovery to production deployment. Learn how AI-powered features like Catalog Explorer integration simplify schema exploration and metadata retrieval, while SQL optimization tools help refine query performance. Weâ€™ll also showcase new capabilities for diagnosing job errors and troubleshooting DLT pipelines, enabling faster debugging and issue resolution in Python-based workflows. Whether you're authoring SQL queries, troubleshooting Python scripts, or debugging production workflows, discover how the Databricks Assistant accelerates development and enhances operational efficiency.

â€‹Turning the Tables on Tuning your Tables: Traditionally, data engineers spend a lot of time on tuning their tables together with their workloads. Picking partition keys. Choosing whether to use ZORDER or partitioning. Scheduling OPTIMIZE and VACUUM. Planning your schedules carefully to avoid concurrent writes and OPTIMIZES... This talk is about how the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform takes all of those worries out of your hands, so that you can focus on your real job. You'll learn about a number of innovations that combine to make your life easier, including Liquid Clustering, Row-Level Concurrency, and Predictive Optimization. Using these features, you can forget about all that manual tuning and get back to the business at hand!

â€‹â€‹SPEAKERS

â€‹â€‹Holly Smith, Staff Developer Advocateâ€‹

event_name: Powering Talent Acquisition with Gen AI
event_summary: This masterclass explores how Dubai's talent acquisition is leveraging GenAI for enhanced efficiency and candidate experience, covering use cases, new tools, and ethical considerations.  Led by expert Sriram Iyer, it's ideal for HR professionals and recruiters seeking a competitive edge through AI-powered recruitment strategies. event_description:
â€‹Dubai's Talent Acquisition and Recruitment functions are undergoing a rapid transformation, primarily due to technological advancements in AI. AI fundamentally changes Talent Acquisition practices by automating routine tasks, enhancing decision-making, and significantly improving the hiring experience.Â 

â€‹With tools such as advanced applicant tracking systems, AI-powered candidate assessments, and intelligent skills matching, companies can better identify top candidates while ensuring strong cultural alignment. Automating repetitive tasks like resume screening and interview scheduling allows recruitment professionals to focus on building relationships and strengthening the employer brand.Â 

â€‹In addition to improving operational efficiency, HR technology greatly enhances the candidate experience. Organizations can create a seamless and engaging hiring journey through personalized communication and virtual onboarding, leaving a positive impression that helps attract the best talent.Â 

â€‹By investing in the right HR tools and integrating them into their processes, organizations can shift from reactive to proactive recruitment strategies, gaining a competitive edge in the race for top-tier talent.

event_name: AI Vibe Code Challenge Dubai 2025 - Coding Sustainability for Dubai's Future
event_summary: The AI Vibe Code Challenge Dubai 2025 is a free coding competition focused on developing AI solutions for Dubai's water scarcity, climate change, and waste management issues.  The event features an expert panel discussion with industry leaders and an exclusive after-party, attracting developers, AI enthusiasts, students, and startups.  Participants compete for a $2,500 grand prize and global exposure via live-streaming.
event_description:
â€‹Tackling Water Scarcity, Climate Change, and Waste Management Through AI Innovation.

â€‹Join us for an electrifying day of innovation, creativity, and competition at the AI Vibe Code Challenge 2025! This unique event, held in the heart of Dubai, brings together the brightest minds in AI and coding to tackle real-world challenges and shape the future of technology.

â€‹Event Highlights:

â€‹AI-Powered Coding Competition: Teams of 2-4 participants will have 6 hours to develop AI-driven solutions addressing Dubai's challenges of water scarcity, climate change and waste management.

â€‹Expert Panel Discussion: Engage with top industry leaders from companies like Microsoft, IBM, and AWS as they share insights on the future of AI and its impact on various sectors.

â€‹Exclusive Afterparty: Celebrate with winners, judges, and fellow tech enthusiasts at an exclusive afterparty featuring live music by renowned local DJ.

â€‹

â€‹What is Vibe Coding?

â€‹
Vibe Coding is a dynamic, collaborative coding experience where participants use AI tools to create innovative solutions. It's not just about writing code; it's about harnessing the power of AI to solve real-world problems in a creative, engaging environment. Whether you're a seasoned developer or a student with a passion for AI, Vibe Coding welcomes all skill levels to come together, learn, and innovate.

â€‹Who Can Join?

â€‹Developers: From beginners to experts, all coding enthusiasts are welcome.

â€‹AI Enthusiasts: If you're passionate about AI and want to apply it to real-world challenges, this event is for you.

â€‹Students: University students and recent graduates looking to showcase their skills and network with industry leaders.

â€‹Startups: Early-stage companies or teams looking to gain visibility and connect with potential investors.

â€‹Tech Professionals: Engineers, data scientists, and anyone interested in AI's future applications.

â€‹Why Attend?

â€‹Compete for Glory: Compete for a grand prize of $2,500 and showcase your coding prowess.

â€‹Network with Industry Leaders: Connect with top panelists, sponsors, and fellow developers for unparalleled networking opportunities.

â€‹Learn from the Best: Gain insights from AI experts during the panel discussion.

â€‹Global Exposure: Your work will be live-streamed to thousands on YouTube, giving you a platform to shine on a global stage.

â€‹Agenda Overview:

â€‹10:00 AM - 11:00 AM: Registration & Intro

â€‹Check-in, grab your swag bag, and network with fellow attendees.

â€‹11:00 AM - 11:30 AM: Opening Remarks & Event Kickoff

â€‹Welcome speech, introduction to the event, and competition rules.

â€‹12:00 AM - 3:00 PM: AI Vibe Coding Competition

â€‹Teams work on AI-driven solutions with live commentary and progress monitoring.

â€‹3:30 PM - 4:00 PM: Break & Refreshments

â€‹Recharge with snacks and drinks before the panel discussion.

â€‹4:00 PM - 6:00 PM: Expert Panel Discussion

â€‹Engage with industry leaders on topics like AI ethics, generative AI, and scaling AI solutions.

â€‹6:30 PM - 7:00 PM: Coding Competition Winner Announcements

â€‹Judges announce winners, followed by a brief Q&A session.

â€‹7:30 PM - 7:45 PM: Transition to Afterparty Venue

â€‹Move to the afterparty location for networking and celebration.

â€‹9:00 PM - 11:00 PM: Exclusive Afterparty

â€‹Enjoy live music, food, drinks, and networking with winners, judges, and attendees.

â€‹Registration:

â€‹Coding Competition: Free to join. Register now to secure your spot!

â€‹Panel Discussion & Afterparty: $200 per person for non-participants. Free for competitors.

â€‹Join the AI Revolution!
Be part of an event that not only challenges your coding skills but also connects you with the future of AI. Register today and code the future with us!

â€‹

event_name: AI Agents UI + Eval + Scale | AI Show and Tell
event_summary: Join fellow AI enthusiasts at GitHub HQ on July 1st for an evening of talks on building, evaluating, and scaling AI agents. full_address: GitHub, 88 Colin P Kelly Jr St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
event_description:
â€‹â€‹Join us on July 1 for our AI Show & Tell monthly event at the GitHub HQ. We'll have several fantastic talks, snacks & drinks, in a beautiful venue. Can't wait to see you there!

â€‹This event is part of Global AI Community, please register there https://globalai.community/chapters/san-francisco/events/ai-show-and-tell-july-1st/

â€‹Agenda

â€‹6 PM: Doors open

â€‹6 - 6:30 PM: Networking, light bites and refreshments

â€‹6:30 - 7:45 PM: Program

â€‹5 min: Intro - Pamela Fox MC, Principal Cloud Advocate @ Microsoft

â€‹15 min: Talk - Michael N MagÃ¡n @ Tambo.co on building AI powered apps

â€‹15 min: Talk - SallyAnn DeLucia @ Arize on evaluation

â€‹15 min: Talk - Philip Kiely @ Baseten on Inference and training

â€‹25 min: Panel + Q&A - Moderated by Pamela Fox

â€‹7:45 - 8:30 PM: Networking part II

â€‹8:30 PM: Event concludes

â€‹â€‹â€‹ğŸŸ Limited spots available â€“ secure your seat now!

â€‹â€‹AI Show & Tell is a monthly series designed to bring together enthusiasts, professionals, and experts in the field of AI. Each event features engaging presentations, interactive demos, and networking opportunities, providing a place for attendees to learn about the latest advancements in AI technology and connect with like-minded individuals.

â€‹

â€‹Talks

â€‹Philip Kiely @ Baseten - Five things to know about AI infrastructure as you scale

â€‹In 2025, AI-native startups are scaling to 8 figures of annual revenue in months. How do you build infrastructure that keeps up with this explosive growth? This talk provides five sometimes-surprising solutions selected from the hardest challenges weâ€™ve faced while working on scaling fast-growing AI startups.

â€‹Michael N Magan @ Tambo.co - Generative UI in Practice: From Intent to Interface

â€‹Generative UI lets AI assistants surface real UI such as charts, forms, and complete workflows exactly when users need them. This talk shows how it works by treating components as tools: mapping user intent to the right component, binding data, and rendering on the fly. A demo of how we use it internally. I'll close with the main opportunities, and the chief challenges. Attendees leave knowing what generative UI is, why it matters, and how to ship it.

â€‹SallyAnn DeLucia @ Arize - Evaluating Agents in the Wild with Arize

Iâ€™ll walk through our new Agent View, which aggregates traces, tool use, and reasoning steps into a structured, searchable formatâ€”making it easier to debug failures, track performance, and iterate on agent design.

event_name: Thought Leadership Dinner "The Convergence of Privacy, Data Security and AI Governance"
event_summary: A private dinner for 16 senior tech executives explored the crucial intersection of AI, data security, and privacy governance.  The event focused on building trustworthy AI systems, navigating global compliance, and fostering innovation without compromising security.  Ideal for Heads of ML, CISOs, and technology leaders seeking strategic solutions.
full_address: San Francisco, California
event_description:
â€‹Join Us for an Exclusive Evening: Unusual Ventures Thought Leadership Dinner

â€‹Weâ€™re excited to invite you to a private gathering of senior engineering and technology executives at the Unusual Ventures Thought Leadership Dinner. This exclusive event is designed to catalyze strategic conversations at the intersection of AI, privacy, and data securityâ€”where emerging risks meet transformative opportunities.

â€‹Youâ€™ll be joining a select group of 16 technology leaders, including:

â€‹John Vrionis, Managing Partner, Unusual Ventures
Niamh O'Donnell, Director of Programs, Unusual Ventures
Abhi Sharma, CEO and Co-Founder, Relyance AI

â€‹Additional guests include top engineering and security minds from leading AI-forward organizations.

â€‹Venue details will be shared directly with registered attendees.

â€‹Topic: The Convergence of Privacy, Data Security, and AI Governance

â€‹As generative and agentic AI systems increasingly influence core business operations, enterprises face a critical challenge: balancing innovation with accountability. The convergence of privacy, data security, and AI governance is no longer a theoretical discussionâ€”itâ€™s a boardroom mandate.

â€‹Next-generation AI architectures require more than technical sophistication; they demand trust, transparency, and resilience. Privacy-preserving machine learning, secure model training, and real-time risk detection are rapidly becoming table stakes. Simultaneously, regulatory expectations around explainability, consent, and data lineage are reshaping how engineering leaders must design and deploy AI systems.

â€‹For Heads of ML, CISOs, and technology executives, this moment calls for intentional leadership:

â€‹How do we build systems that are not only intelligent, but inherently trustworthy?

â€‹How do we future-proof our data and AI pipelines for a fragmented global compliance landscape?

â€‹And how can we embed governance into AI development without slowing down innovation?

â€‹This executive roundtable will unpack these strategic imperatives:

â€‹What architectural principles drive AI systems that are secure, private by design, and auditable at scale?

â€‹How can companies align AI governance with data strategy to create sustainable competitive advantage?

â€‹What best practices are emerging across high-stakes industriesâ€”and what lessons can we learn from early adopters?

â€‹Join us for a candid, high-impact discussion on operationalizing trustworthy AI at scaleâ€”where security, privacy, and governance are not afterthoughts, but foundational design pillars.

event_name: Turn your Codex agents into a production-grade coding team with a cloud backend
event_summary: This workshop teaches developers how to deploy and manage open-source Codex coding agents as a production-ready team using a cloud backend (xpander.ai) and observability tools (AgentOps.ai).  Participants will build and deploy cloud-based, event-triggered agent workflows in a hands-on session, eliminating the need for brittle local scripts.  Ideal for developers, AI engineers, and enthusiasts seeking to scale their AI agent projects.
full_address: AWS Builder Loft, 525 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
event_description:
â€‹Open-source coding agents are ready for production - if you give them the runtime they deserve.

â€‹â€‹If youâ€™ve already tried Codex, you know itâ€™s powerful - but turning it into a reliable developer sidekick requires significant effort. Youâ€™ll need to manage sessions, handle long-running tasks, secure sandbox and terminal access, integrate with third-party services like GitHub and deal with A2A to allow multi-agents deployments so you can build a team of coding agents.

â€‹â€‹This workshop is for developers and AI agent builders who want to run open-source coding agents in the cloud, as part of a team, with the right infrastructure behind them.

â€‹â€‹Weâ€™ll walk through how to take local coding agents and run them with a proper backend: secure runtimes, persistent memory, triggers via MCP right from your IDE, and multi-agent orchestration using A2A (Agent-to-Agent). No more running brittle scripts on your laptop. No more glue code. Just real infrastructure, ready to scale your agents from toy to teammate.

â€‹â€‹Weâ€™ll use xpander.ai, backend-as-a-service for agents, to set up, deploy, and orchestrate coding agents that can interact, share state, and get real work done even when you're offline. Weâ€™ll use AgentOps for observability, to monitor, debug, and understand our AI agents' behavior with time-travel session replays, prompt-level insights, and detailed traces of tool calls, errors, and token usage.

â€‹â€‹In under three hours, youâ€™ll go from zero to running agent workflows that are cloud-deployed, event-triggered, and fully observable.

â€‹â€‹Agenda:

â€‹â€‹5:00â€“5:30 PM | Gathering, snacks, networking
5:30â€“5:50 PM | Tech talk 1: The three most important things you need for running coding agents in the cloud
5:50â€“6:10 PM | Demo 1: xpander.ai
6:10â€“6:30 PM | Demo 2: AgentOps.ai
6:30â€“8:00 PM | Hands-on workshop - build it on your own
7:00 | Pizza is served ğŸ•
8:00â€“8:30 PM | Progress check-in and wrap-up

â€‹â€‹Who Should Attend:

â€‹â€‹Developers that are actively building AI Agents

â€‹â€‹Developers and DevEx engineers that want to accelerate dev processes

â€‹â€‹AI Platform engineers and AI Squad members

â€‹â€‹AI Agent Enthusiasts and hobbyists

â€‹â€‹Prerequisites

â€‹â€‹â€‹âŒš Please come with laptops and Cursor/Windsurf/VSCode MCP Extension pre-installed

event_name: Open Lab: July 2nd, 2025
event_summary: Explore the semantic interpretation of dance through movement experiments & AI analysis at this Open Lab (July 2nd, 2025).  Combine contact improvisation with tennis balls and data collection to understand meaning encoded in dance sequences. Limited to 15 participantsâ€”register now!
full_address: 3175 17th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
event_description:
â€‹Can dance have semantic interpretations? Thatâ€™s exactly what weâ€™ve been exploring in our Open Labs.

â€‹Last week, we ran a small experimentâ€”using a camera and AI to capture motion dataâ€”then ran some very preliminary analysis, pose by pose. You can check out the results in this blog post:

â€‹ğŸ‘‰ Semantic Interpretation of Dance Sequences (Part 1)

â€‹It visualizes how a movement sequence maps into a simple two-dimensional semantic space.

â€‹This Wednesday, weâ€™ll design a few new experiments and collect more data to better understand the meaning encoded in movement. Instead of analyzing individual poses, weâ€™ll look at 0.5-second chunks to see if short motion phrases carry more useful information.

â€‹You may ask, why do this? One reason is to explore how a system could observe a dance, learn its patterns, and eventually predict what comes nextâ€”just like we do when we watch someone move.

â€‹Meanwhile, weâ€™ll keep rolling (literally) with our contact improvisation with tennis balls as a third partner. Think movement, play, and maybe a bit of massage, too.

â€‹Come move, explore, and play with us!

â€‹ğŸ§ âœ¨ We have space for only 15 participants, so please make sure to register in advance.

â€‹Come play, connect, and experiment with us!

â€‹Follow us on Instagram:Â @kinetecharts

â€‹Join our Slack community

â€‹Photo from last lab

â€‹Email us atÂ info@kinetecharts.orgÂ with any questions or ideas!

event_name: Survival of the Smartest: Evolutionary AI for Social Good

This event was geared toward those interested in AI, science, and social impact, requiring attendees to be 21+.

event_name: AI Agent SF Meetup #4 - Agent Evaluations
event_summary: The San Francisco AI Agent Meetup #4 focused on evaluating and monitoring AI agents in production, featuring talks from leading experts at IBM, Comet, Arize, and Vectara.  Key topics included best practices for observability, cost tracking, and mitigating issues like hallucinations and bias.  This event was geared towards experienced AI developers and researchers interested in building and deploying AI agents.
full_address: San Francisco, California
event_description:
â€‹Our 4th AI Agent Meetup is sponsored by BeeAI.

â€‹The SF AI Agent Meetup is a new & growing community for AI Agent Developers, Engineers, UX, Ops, and Applied Researchers exploring and leading the evolution of AI agents. Whether you're building autonomous systems, experimenting with LLM-powered assistants, or integrating AI agents into real-world applications, this meetup is the place to discover, share insights, and collaborate with your peers. Join us for talks, demos, discussions and networking with like-minded innovators shaping the next generation of AI.

â€‹â€‹ğŸ“† Agenda

â€‹â€‹5:00 pm â€“ Checkin & Networking

â€‹â€‹5:30 pm â€“ Introductions & Welcome

â€‹â€‹5:45 pm â€“ Lightning Talk

â€‹Natural Language Interaction Protocol (NLIP) by Ranjan Sinha, IBM Fellow

â€‹6:00 pm - Talks:

â€‹"Best Practices for Monitoring Agent Applications in Production" by Claire Longo, Lead AI Researcher at Comet

â€‹Agent Evaluation by Shrilakshmi Chavali of Arize

â€‹Open RAG Eval by Ofer Mendelevitch at Vectara

â€‹â€‹7:30 pm â€“ Open Networking w/ Pizza and Sodas

â€‹8:30 pm â€“ Close

â€‹Talk Details:

â€‹Talk #1 - "Best Practices for Monitoring Agent Applications in Production" by Claire Longo, Lead AI Researcher at Comet - Building AI agents requires a shift from monolithic to modular architectures, especially when dealing with the non-deterministic nature of LLMs. Traditional monitoring falls short as Agents can silently escalate costs, hallucinate, and generate biased outputs. In this talk, Claire will share practical strategies for AI Agent Observability, including cost tracking, eval metrics, and automated Agent Optimization. She will also introduce Comet Opik, an open-source tool designed to optimize and monitor AI Agents in real time.Â 

â€‹â€‹We look forward to building San Francisco's AI Agent community together! ğŸš€

â€‹Food and drink, engaging conversation, and incredible company will all be provided!

â€‹This AI Alliance event is sponsored by BeeAI.

â€‹Why join?
This is your chance to dive deep into the world of AI agents, connect with a new and emerging developer community. This event is designed for experienced developers, and those who are curious about agents.

â€‹â€‹â€‹Please be advised: Unfortunately, space is very limited at these community events and we can not always accept everyone we would like to. We appreciate your application and are looking forward to seeing you at a future event!

â€‹By coming to this event you agree to be part of group photographs which are used for community building and promoting future events.

â€‹â€‹Code of Conduct: We expect our members to treat each other like family, so please click here to read our Code of Conduct. If you see someone violating it, please speak with your event organizer or reach out to dnielsen@thealliance.ai.

â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹The AI Alliance is a non-profit, grassroots community of 150+ companies, startups, researchers, and individuals. Through world-class events, online events, and workshops, members leverage their diverse perspectives and innovative minds to foster meaningful relationships, solve challenging problems, and define the future of AI.

event_name: LAUNCH: Open-Source Data Linking for AI Agents
event_summary: Celebrate the launch of Get Gather, an open-source API enabling seamless data linking for AI agents,  with live demos showcasing innovative applications like personalized return reminders and AI-generated avatars.  This event is ideal for developers and anyone interested in the future of AI and open-source data integration.
full_address: 2479 E Bayshore Rd suite 270, Palo Alto, CA 94303, USA
event_description:
â€‹Come celebrate the launch of Get Gather, an open-source project designed to supercharge data linking for AI agents!

â€‹Get Gather is an API that connects to the apps your users love, from Amazon to Zara. The open source project offers a growing library of data connectors that make it possible to integrate third-party user data into your AI workflows, securely and at scale. Built for developers, Get Gather accesses and extracts consumer data in structured form, ready to plug into AI agents.

â€‹Join us at the launch event hosted by Ario to see Get Gather in action through three live demos:

â€‹Return Reminders: an agent that reminds you to drop off Amazon returns before the deadline.

â€‹Data Portraits: AI-generated avatars built from your real activity across apps like DoorDash and Goodreads.

â€‹Data Links (MCPs): modular connection points that let your agent securely access user data from consumer platforms.

â€‹Whether you're deep in AI dev or just curious about the future, swing by for live demos, good vibes, and snacks. Letâ€™s toast to open-source innovation and connect with fellow builders!

event_name: GenAI Applications: Development to Production
event_summary: This Bay Area networking event focuses on deploying and scaling GenAI solutions, featuring insights from Nutanix and PingCAP experts.  Attendees learned practical strategies for managing GPU deployments on Kubernetes, building fast FAQ systems, and balancing budget, authenticity, and reasoning in GenAI.  Ideal for platform engineers, architects, and developers working with AI/ML and  Kubernetes.
full_address: 1740 Technology Dr, San Jose, CA 95110, USA
event_description:
â€‹â€‹Join us for an opportunity to network with AI applications developers in the Bay Area! Hear insights from speakers representing Nutanix and PingCAP as they discuss the latest advancements in building and deploying scalable GenAI solutions.

Agenda

â€‹â€‹â€‹5:30 - 6:00 pm: Check-in/networking (food & drinks)

â€‹6:00 - 6:30 pm: Talk #1 - Lessons learned from managing GPU deployments on Kubernetes

â€‹â€‹6:30 - 7:00 pm: Talk #2 - Ship a Lightning-Fast FAQ & Stop Keyword Fails

â€‹â€‹7:00 - 7:30: Talk #3 - Setting the BAR: Balancing Budget, Authenticity & Reasoning in GenAI

â€‹7:30 - 8:00: Wrap-up/networking

â€‹Talk #1: Lessons learned from managing GPU deployments on Kubernetes

â€‹Speakers: Sonali Mishra & Shalin Patel (Nutanix)
Abstract: Handling workloads that require GPU on Kubernetes has become easier with tools like NVIDIAâ€™s GPU Operator but deploying them in production across real-world environments brings hidden challenges. In this session, we will share lessons learned from managing GPU across different infrastructures including on-prem and across public clouds, air-gapped environments, and different Operating Systems. We will cover compatibility issues with drivers and runtimes, discovering GPU attached nodes and scheduling GPU workloads on Kubernetes clusters. We will also discuss our experience working with vGPUs, the challenges of enabling multi-tenancy, dynamic resource allocation and monitoring. And lastly, we will talk about how we addressed some of these challenges using the NVIDIA GPU operator and our Kubernetes operator for vGPU tokens and license management. This talk is ideal for platform engineers and architects bringing AI/ML to Kubernetes, and looking to scale GPU use efficiently, securely and with better observability.


â€‹Talk #2 - Ship a Lightning-Fast FAQ & Stop Keyword Fails

Speaker: Chris Dabatos (PingCAP)
Abstract: In this session, learn how anyone can build & ship a lightning-fast FAQ with TiDB's built-in vector search with AWS Bedrock and a few plain English Python scripts. There's no need for developers to deal with microservices or cluster baby sitting, and since TiDB is MySQL compatible, your existing "ORM" will just work.

â€‹Talk #3 - Setting the BAR: Balancing Budget, Authenticity & Reasoning in GenAI


â€‹Speaker: Jinan Zhou (Nutanix)
Abstract: There is no perfect GenAI cocktailâ€”every system has to mix Budget, Authenticity, and Reasoning. Raise the BAR on two, and youâ€™ll have to water down the third.

â€‹In this session, weâ€™ll introduce the BAR Triangle, a framework for understanding why itâ€™s impossible to fully optimize every dimension of a GenAI system at once. Through practical examples and case studies, youâ€™ll learn how to map your own system onto the triangle, identify the hidden costs of maximizing certain aspects, and develop strategies for choosing the right BAR for your product. Whether youâ€™re building enterprise AI, consumer chatbots, or mission-critical GenAI, this talk will help you make smarter, more transparent tradeoffsâ€”and â€œset the BARâ€ that matters most for your goals.

event_name: FUTURECRAFT 2035 â€“ Showcase + Afterparty
event_summary: FUTURECRAFT 2035 showcases six expert teams' visions of the robotics landscape in 2035, revealing key investment opportunities and unmet market needs.  This event offers actionable insights and networking with robotics experts, founders, and investors, ideal for entrepreneurs, investors, and innovators seeking a strategic advantage.  An afterparty follows the presentations and Q&A.
full_address: Frontier Tower | Berlinhouse, 995 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
event_description:
â€‹FUTURECRAFT 2035 Showcase: Robotics in 2035

â€‹Why Attend?

â€‹Technological innovationâ€”particularly in roboticsâ€”is transforming industries at an unprecedented rate. Staying ahead of these changes isn't just advantageous; it's critical for your future relevance and success.

â€‹At the FUTURECRAFT 2035 Robotics Showcase, we're making cutting-edge strategic foresight accessible to everyone. Strategic foresight is a structured approach to exploring future scenarios, identifying emerging trends, and preparing proactively for disruption.

Traditionally leveraged by Fortune 100 companies, we're now bringing this powerful approach directly to founders, investors, and innovators.

â€‹Join us as six expert teams, guided by leading robotics specialists, reveal the outcomes of our intensive foresight workshop. Each team has rigorously explored potential futures for robotics, crafting detailed, plausible scenarios for the year 2035. Through dynamic, lightning-fast presentations, these robotics experts will highlight:

event_name: Mentra Live Hackathon
event_summary: The Mentra Live Hackathon (July 12-13, San Francisco) challenges 100 developers to build groundbreaking AR/AI apps using cutting-edge smart glasses with an open SDK.  Participants compete for prizes (including free glasses), expert mentorship, and the chance to shape the future of wearable tech.  Ideal for skilled hackers and developers interested in AI, video streaming, and wearable technology.
full_address: Y Combinator, 560 20th St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
event_description:
â€‹Join us for the Mentra Live Smart Glasses Hackathon, hosted at YC July 12-13 in San Francisco!

â€‹100 cracked hackers and devs. 100 pairs of camera smart glasses.

â€‹Ever wished the Meta Ray-Ban had an SDK? That's Mentra Live. The Mentra Live has an open SDK, app store, camera, speakers, and microphone. Itâ€™s ~40grams and can stream video anywhere, including to your own app. The battery lasts all day. Itâ€™s sick. We're bringing the hardware you've been waiting for, now what will you build with it?

â€‹1/3 of hackers who walk in will walk out with free smart glasses, build something cool to qualify!

â€‹We'll also have Roboflow engineers onsite to help with your image analysis ideas! Other partnerships to be announced soon.

â€‹More Details:

â€‹Get exclusive early access to Mentra Live smartglasses running the MentraOS platform. Create groundbreaking apps leveraging real-time AI, video streaming, AR, and more.

â€‹Mentra engineers will be on-site to assist you throughout the hackathon

â€‹Compete to win prizes (smart glasses) and recognition for your creations.

â€‹Kick off Saturday morning at 10am, hacking through to 9:30 pm, take a break to rest, and resume Sunday morning at 9:30 am. Judging and lunch Sunday at 2pm. Video demo videos 4pm-8pm.

â€‹Breakfast and dinner are served both days.

â€‹Spots are limited, apply now and shape the future of wearable AI technology!

â€‹Experience the Future at GenAI Week

â€‹Step into the forefront of AI at GenAI Week Silicon Valley 2025 â€“ where innovation meets execution, and tomorrow is crafted today for everyone!

â€‹Audience â€“ The typical attendee profile is deeply embedded in the GenAI ecosystem. 70% will be professionals from the product/sales side, while 30% will represent the demand/buy side. A significant 80% of attendees will be from the Bay Area, including founders, Fortune 500 solution buyers, senior PMs/GMs, architects/developers, BD/Marketing experts, sales professionals, designers, investors, and corporate solution decision-makers.

Conference Structure â€“ The summit will feature two main stages, two expansive exhibition floors, and 15 breakout rooms available for sponsor use. Each session will either be a keynote or a panel discussion, typically lasting under an hour. For more details, visit the agenda section on our official website: www.genaisummit.ai.

Speakers â€“ Confirmed speakers will be listed on the website. We anticipate over 800 thought leaders, including founders and C-suite executives from the top 1000 startups.

â€‹Media â€“ Expect significant media coverage with 20+ international outlets in attendance.

â€‹About Us â€“ We are GPTDAO. Since 2022, we have been leading the charge in AI with a track record of organizing 100+ offline events, 200+ online events, and building a community of about 30,000+ members in the Bay Area.

â€‹Video Clips from Previous Events: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x7C6egXuApY

â€‹Exhibition and Sponsor Opportunities

â€‹SHOWCASE YOUR PRODUCT TO EVERYONE AT THE SUMMIT!

â€‹Located in the exhibition hall, the Booth allows you to conduct meetings while ensuring optimal brand exposure. Brand's logos will be featured on signage throughout the venue, displayed on website and brochures.

â€‹Check the official conference website for full speaker list, sponsor prospectus and agenda.

â€‹Please be aware that exhibition packages are generally non-transferable and non-refundable. Exceptions may be considered in exceptional circumstances, subject to the discretion of the event organizers. We appreciate your understanding in maintaining the integrity of our event planning and ticketing process.

event_name: Hello, Self-Writing Internet
event_summary: The "Hello, Self-Writing Internet" event showcased Caffeine, a new AI tech stack, through demos, panels, and a hackathon.  This San Francisco event (livestreamed globally) targeted AI enthusiasts, developers, and investors interested in the future of AI-driven internet development.  Networking and immersive experiences were key components.
full_address: Dogpatch Studios, 991 Tennessee St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
event_description:
â€‹ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ San Francisco
ğŸŒ Livestream
ğŸ—“ï¸ July 15th, 2025
â±ï¸ 10:00 AMâ€“10:00 PM (PDT)

â€‹Join us for a day to explore and experience the self-writing internet with Caffeine, the first complete tech stack designed for AI, where humans build through conversation only.

Set across three immersive floors and livestreamed worldwide, this event brings together AI enthusiasts, developers, builders, and visionaries shaping the future of tech.

â€‹Did you miss the Caffeine Demo reveal on June 3rd, 2025? Watch the recording here.

â€‹Highlights

â€‹Main Stage (Floor 1): Keynotes, demos, panels, and presentations.

â€‹Caffeine Hackathon (Floor 2): A high-energy builder zoneâ€”code, collaborate, and compete with fellow hackers and mentors, for both technical and non-technical participants.

â€‹Networking (Floor 3): Recharge and connect with guests over specialty coffee, drinks, and immersive visuals.

â€‹Whoâ€™s Attending

â€‹AI enthusiasts, builders, developers, ecosystem partners, investors, and media.

â€‹Main Stage Program

â€‹10:00 - 10:30: Welcome & Networking

â€‹19:00 - 22:00: Music, Drinks, Flying Dinner & Caffeine Experience Pods

â€‹What to Expect from the Main Stage

â€‹Get inspired with keynotes, panels, and fireside chats featuring pioneers shaping the self-writing internet.

â€‹See the Self-Writing Internet in action through live Caffeine demos.

â€‹Build apps on Caffeine at dedicated Caffeine Experience Pods â€” open throughout the day for you to experience the Self-Writing Internet first-hand.

â€‹Connect with fellow AI enthusiasts during networking breaks.

â€‹Celebrate innovation at the Hackathon Showcase & Awards, followed by an evening of music, good vibes, flying dinner, and drinks.

â€‹Caffeine Hackathon Program

â€‹8:00 - 9:00: Welcome & Registration

â€‹9:00 - 9:15: Briefing & Hackathon Kick-OffÂ 

â€‹9:15 - 16:00: HackathonÂ (Technical & Non-Technical Tracks)

â€‹Caffeine Hackathon Notes

â€‹Welcome to the first-ever Caffeine Hackathon, held from 9:00 to 19:00 on July 15th, 2025, at Dogpatch Studios, San Francisco, during the "Hello, Self-Writing Internet" event.

â€‹This is an invite-only hackathon, open to a maximum of 50 technical and 50 non-technical participants.

â€‹To submit your interest in participating in the Caffeine Hackathon, please secure your Hackathon Pass on Luma and complete this registration form. Our team will review your application and follow up via email.

â€‹Seats are limited and will be offered on a first-come, first-served basis for qualified applicants. The application deadline is July 10th, 2025, at 20:00 PDT.

â€‹Coaching, mentoring, and judging are provided during the day, along with refreshments, food, and drinks.Â 

â€‹Event Guidelines

â€‹Registration is required for all guests. A QR Registration Code is required to access the event.

â€‹Capacity is limited. Entry is available on a first-come, first-served basis until the venue reaches capacity.

â€‹Badge Pickup is available from 10:00 at the registration desk.

â€‹Event photography and video recording will take place. Attendance implies consent to be photographed or filmed.

â€‹The venue is fully accessible. If you have specific needs, please don't hesitate to contact us in advance so we can assist you effectively.

â€‹Networking opportunities: Scheduled breaks are designed to facilitate networking and provide opportunities for connection. We encourage you to engage respectfully with all participants.

â€‹Code of conduct: We strive for a collaborative and harassment-free experience for everyone.

event_name: Meetup: Low-Latency Data Systems for Real-Time AI (Mountain View, CA)
event_summary: This Mountain View meetup explored cutting-edge low-latency data systems crucial for real-time AI and analytics.  Experts from Confluent, Alluxio, and StarTree showcased innovative solutions for fast querying of petabyte-scale data lakes and unifying streaming & analytics for LLM serving.  Ideal for data engineers, AI specialists, and anyone building real-time AI applications.
full_address: StarTree Inc, 100 View St UNIT 204, Mountain View, CA 94041, USA
event_description:
â€‹Join us for a night of tech talks on the systems and data infrastructure that enable low-latency, real-time AI and analytics, including fast querying for object stores, MCP, RAG, unifying streaming & analytics, and LLM serving & inference.

â€‹â€‹ğŸ¤ Speakers

â€‹â€‹ğŸŒŸ Tim Berglund, VP Developer Relations @ Confluent

â€‹ğŸŒŸ Bin Fan, VP of Technology @ Alluxio

â€‹ğŸŒŸ Songqiao Su, Staff Software Engineer @ StarTree

â€‹â€‹ğŸ“… Agenda

â€‹â€‹Doors open at 5:00 PMâ€‹â€‹

â€‹â€‹5:00 PM: Arrival and check-in

â€‹â€‹5:30 PM: Presentations

â€‹ğŸ’¡ Meet You in the Middle: 1000Ã— Performance for Parquet Queries on PB-Scale Data Lakes by Bin Fan

â€‹ğŸ’¡ Introduction to Apache Icebergâ„¢ & Tableflow by Tim Berglund

â€‹ğŸ’¡ Optimizing Tiered Storage for Low-Latency Real-Time Analytics at AI Scale by Songqiao Su

â€‹â€‹â€‹7:15 PM: Networking and pizza

â€‹â€‹Doors close at 8:00 PM

â€‹â€‹ğŸ“– Presentation Details

â€‹ğŸ’¡ Meet You in the Middle: 1000Ã— Performance for Parquet Queries on PB-Scale Data Lakes

â€‹Storing data as Parquet files on S3 is increasingly used not just as a data lake but also as a lightweight feature store for ML training/inference or a document store for RAG. However, querying petabyte- to exabyte-scale data lakes directly from cloud object storage remains notoriously slow (e.g., latencies ranging from hundreds of milliseconds to several seconds on AWS S3).

â€‹In this talk, we show how architecture co-design, system-level optimizations, and workload-aware engineering can deliver over 1000Ã— performance improvements for these workloadsâ€”without changing file formats, rewriting data paths, or provisioning expensive hardware.

â€‹We introduce a high-performance, low-latency S3 proxy layer powered by Alluxio, deployed atop hyperscale data lakes. This proxy delivers sub-millisecond Time-to-First-Byte (TTFB)â€”on par with Amazon S3 Expressâ€”while preserving compatibility with standard S3 APIs. In real-world benchmarks, a 50-node Alluxio cluster sustains over 1 million S3 queries per second, offering 50Ã— the throughput of S3 Express for a single account, with no compromise in latency.

â€‹Beyond accelerating access to Parquet files byte-to-byte, we also offload partial Parquet processing from query engines via a pluggable interface into Alluxio. This eliminates the need for costly index scans and file parsing, enabling point queries with 0.3 microseconds latency and up to 3,000 QPS per instance (measured using a single-thread)â€”a 100Ã— improvement over traditional query paths.

â€‹ğŸ’¡ Introduction to Apache Icebergâ„¢ & Tableflow

â€‹The data lake is a fantastic, low-cost place to put data at rest for offline analytics, but we've built it under the terms of a terrible bargain: all that cheap storage at scale was a great thing, but we gave up schema management and transactions along the way. Apache Iceberg has emerged as king of the Open Table Formats to fix this very problem.

â€‹Built on the foundation of Parquet files, Iceberg adds a simple yet flexible metadata layer and integration with standard data catalogs to provide robust schema support and ACID transactions to the once ungoverned data lake. In this talk, we'll build Iceberg up from the basics, see how the read and write path work, and explore how it supports streaming data sources like Apache Kafkaâ„¢. Then we'll see how Confluent's Tableflow brings Kafka together with open table formats like Iceberg and Delta Lake to make operational data in Kafka topics instantly visible to the data lake without the usual ETLâ€”unifying the operational/analytical divide that has been with us for decades.

â€‹ğŸ’¡ Optimizing Tiered Storage for Low-Latency Real-Time Analytics at AI Scale

â€‹Real-time OLAP databases are optimized for speed and often rely on tightly coupled storage-compute architectures using disks or SSDs. Decoupled architectures, which use cloud object storage, introduce an unavoidable tradeoff: cost efficiency at the expense of performance. This makes them unsuitable for databases that need to provide low-latency, real-time analytics, especially the new wave of LLM-powered dashboards, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and vector-embedding searches that thrive only when fresh data is milliseconds away. Can we achieve both cost efficiency and performance?

â€‹In this talk, weâ€™ll explore the engineering challenges of extending Apache Pinotâ€”a real-time OLAP systemâ€”onto cloud object storage while still maintaining sub-second P99 latencies.

â€‹Weâ€™ll dive into how we built an abstraction in Apache Pinot to make it agnostic to the location of data. Weâ€™ll explain how we can query data directly from the cloud (without needing to download the entire dataset, as with lazy-loading) while achieving sub-second latencies. Weâ€™ll cover the data fetch and optimization strategies we implemented, such as pipelining fetch and compute, prefetching, selective block fetches, index pinning, and more. We'll also share our latest work about integration with open table formats like iceberg, and how we will continue to achieve fast analytics directly on parquet files by implementing all the same techniques that apply to tiered storage.

event_name: The Agentic Browser Summit
event_summary: The Agentic Browser Summit (July 15th) explores the future of browsing via AI-powered agents that relentlessly pursue user needs, exceeding the limitations of current search and answer engines.  This inaugural event features keynotes, discussions, and product demos showcasing this revolutionary technology.  The summit targets developers, AI enthusiasts, and anyone interested in the future of software and user experience.
full_address: Shack15, 1, Ferry Building, Suite 201, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
event_description:
â€‹The Agentic Browser Summit is our inaugural collective of keynotes, discussions, and industry perspectives taking on the most ambitious end-game of software with a goal to improve human life. This is Day 1 of this movement, and we at Hyperspace welcome everyone tinkering, thinking about, or building components for it to come together. If you want to present something remarkable as well, please DM me on X (@varun_mathur).

â€‹PS: I apologize for re-schedule of this event to July 15th (confirmed date) and the disruption in travel plans it might have caused for some. Given the scale of interest in this, we are determined to put on an unforgettable evening of delightful product demos and discussion. We also have some exclusive and priority access and rewards planned for those who RSVP-ed early.Â - Varun

â€‹A backstory on why we at Hyperspace have been building it:

â€‹the idea of an agentic browser pokes at the idea of how do the agents rank and utilize each other in order to best serve users. we believe this compounds user utility over time. Search engines have built-in network effects: more people use the web, the smarter they (ought to) become with more credible websites â€œvotingâ€ for webpages in an uber-democratic real-time process. this compounds and compresses societyâ€™s knowledge.

â€‹is it true with single-shot AI answer engines which are wrapping search results ? you ask a question, get generated answer and move on - how does that feedback into making the underlying system a lot smarter over time ? what has it learnt about that page compared to other pages which fundamentally improves the experience for the Nth user ?

â€‹for example - consider the â€œrental carâ€ problem.Â 

â€‹1) enter that term in a search engine like Google, what do you get ? list of top car rental websites

â€‹2) enter it in an answer engine, what do you get ? you get English-ized version of (1) above. great, now you know the names of the biggest rental car companies in the US. as a user, you are basically back at (1) above.Â 

â€‹what did you as a user really want ? you wanted the best rental car options for you and also things happening leading to a booking: based on your needs and preferences. so right answer for you would have been a series of actions:

â€‹- a question: which city do you need this in and approximately when ? what kind of cars do you like to drive ?Â 

â€‹- found you these Tesla Model 3 rentals, available on these dates for this price, and booking available on these few websites and apps,Â 

â€‹- and i will re-run this analysis every 30 mts for next 2 weeks until your travel to see if can find you a better price and negotiate behind the scenesÂ 

â€‹this, is the next society productivity unlock as this is the flow the user would have been the MOST happiest with. that is the 5 star user experience. and thatâ€™s only going to happen in the most seamless way in a software system custom-designed for this purpose, an agentic browser, which leverages AI agents (nameless processes recursively spanning and orchestrating themselves using all types of infrastructure necessary in order to satisfy the user need).Â 

â€‹where a search engine and an answer engine â€œgives upâ€ after showing rudimentary options, the agentic browser is a relentless beast of a machine which keeps on running and processing, and orchestrating many agents together into getting the job done for the user. during this time, it is learning and compounding on the nature of agents and their interactions themselvesâ€™. it is not just a standalone software, but a network, and it requires a different DNA altogether.Â 

â€‹this is the world we are building, and it spans many components: from a revolutionary new user interface, to insanely powerful on-device capabilities, to plugging into the worldâ€™s largest distributed data and compute cluster, and using the right decentralized protocols for agent-to-agent transactions and payments to build trust in the system.Â 

â€‹this is going to be the largest new economy built from scratch this decade.

event_name: Beyond Fine-Tuning: Frontiers in LLM Post Training, Hosted by Assembled
event_summary: Assembled hosted a panel of leading LLM researchers (Anthropic, OpenAI, Amazon) discussing post-training advancements, focusing on challenges like reward hacking and "thought disclosure."  The event targeted founders and builders needing to deploy LLMs this year, offering technical depth and networking opportunities.
full_address: Assembled, Inc., 2525 16th St #310, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
event_description:
â€‹Join us for a candid, forward-looking conversation on what happens after you pre-train a large language modelâ€”tailored for founders and builders who have to ship this year, not someday.

Our panel of hands-on researchers will unpack where post-training is headed in the next 6â€“12 months, how reward-hacking headaches are evolving, what â€œthought disclosureâ€ might really look like, and which open problems Big Labs are scrambling to solveâ€”so startups can place smarter bets today.

Expect technical depth, plenty of audience Q&A, and time to network over good snacks and drinks.

Panelists
Arushi Somani â€“ Research Scientist at Anthropic
Arushi is a researcher at Anthropic, where she works on reinforcement learning and alignment for frontier Claude models. Arushi was a core contributor to Claude 3.7 and Claude 4, and her research focus on measuring and improving the faithfulness of reasoning models as well as supervision-free post-training methods. Previously, she worked on pre-training large multimodal models at Adept and deep neural networks for program synthesis at the Berkeley Sky Lab.

Bowen Baker â€“ Research Scientist at OpenAI
Bowen leads the team working on chain-of-thought interpretability at OpenAI, where his work centers on topics such as detecting misbehavior in frontier reasoning models. His previous work at OpenAI has spanned topics including multi-agent autocurricula, state estimation from vision, attention based network architectures for reinforcement learning, and most recently multi-agent social dilemma games.

Jacob van Gogh â€“ Research Scientist at Amazon AGI SF Lab
Jacob builds planning and agentic tool-use systems for Amazonâ€™s newly formed AGI SF Lab, contributing to the labâ€™s â€œNovaâ€ foundation-model program. Jacob has also worked on LLM planning and tool use at Adept. Previously he spent four years at Lyft, where he led the real-time online-learning initiative for dispatch and pricing.

Moderator: Joe Gershenson â€“ Head of Engineering, Assembled
Joe leads engineering at Assembled, turning cutting-edge LLM research into production-grade support agents used by hundreds of enterprises. Before Assembled he directed research engineering at Adept, ran ML infrastructure at Stripe, and co-founded a YC-backed predictive-modeling startup.

event_name: The Global Agent Economy
event_summary: The Global Agent Economy event explored the burgeoning field of AI agents autonomously conducting commerce, predicting a future dominated by AI-driven transactions.  Experts discussed crucial aspects like interoperability standards, governance, and the implications for global supply chains and traditional businesses.  This event targets leaders in business, technology, and policy seeking to understand and prepare for this transformative economic shift.
full_address: Post-Industrial Institute, 333 Ravenswood Ave, Menlo Park, CA 94025, USA
event_description:
â€‹AI agents are yielding dramatic productivity improvements in enterprise functions where they are successfully deployed. In this session, we will look at happens when they engage in commerce.

â€‹We are witnessing the rise of AI agents capable of autonomously discovering products and services, negotiating terms, and executing transactionsâ€”all at unprecedented speed and scale. These AI agents are poised to become active participants in the global economy.

â€‹Within the next decade, it is likely that the vast majority of transactions will take place between AI agents. This shift will reshape supply chains, reduce coordination costs, accelerate growth, and challenge traditional firms as the primary units of economic organization. The implications for infrastructure, governance, and competition are profound.

â€‹We will discuss:

â€‹Autonomous discovery, negotiation, and coordination

â€‹Standards for payments and interoperability

â€‹Distributed ledgers and smart contracts

â€‹Governance and monitoring in dynamic networks of agents

â€‹Humans in the loop vs. agent autonomy

â€‹Legal and regulatory obstacles

â€‹What it means for AI agents to become the dominant economic actors

â€‹Implications for global supply chains, marketplaces, and cross-border digital commerce

â€‹Lessons from economic history

â€‹Enterprises vs. startups in the Global Agent Economy

â€‹Speakers

â€‹Dr. Tatyana Mamut, CEO, Wayfound

â€‹Dr. Zafer Sahinoglu, GM, Mitsubishi Electric Innovation Center

â€‹Dr. Tomaz Suklje, CEO, Nordoon

â€‹Frode L. Odegard, CEO, Post-Industrial Institute

â€‹Member workshop
2:00pm-5pm Workshop: Building The Agent Economy
(in-person and online, non-members can attend one time for a fee)

â€‹Public program:
5:00pm-6:00pm: Networking and refreshments
6:00pm-6:05pm: Welcome
6:05pm-6:30pm: The Agent Economy (Frode Odegard)
6:30pm: Panelist presentations, discussion, Q&A
8:00pm: CloseÂ 

Our host: This event is kindly sponsored by our friends at SRI, a pioneer in AI research since the 1960s. Some of the earliest work on AI agents was done at SRI.

About the Post-Industrial Forum

â€‹Based in Silicon Valley, the Post-Industrial Institute (PII) was founded by Frode Odegard in 2004. Our mission is to develop new management science, frameworks, and tools for leaders building the firms of the future.

â€‹In 2019, we launched the Post-Industrial Forumâ€”a community for visionary leaders who are building new pathbreaking firms or transforming leading enterprises. Members connect with peers, learn together, and apply insights to accelerate their journey.

â€‹We share original PII research with members and invite industry experts and executives from pioneering organizations to offer their insights. The Forum hosts public events and summits, as well as member-exclusive programs delivered both in person and online through a dedicated member portal featuring exclusive content.

â€‹Speaker bios

â€‹Dr. Tatyana Mamut
Co-Founder & CEO
Wayfound

â€‹Tatyana Mamut is Co-Founder & CEO of Wayfound, which helps companies manage and find ROI with AI agents. Since 2001, she has been a transformative product leader driving innovation through several technology shifts at AWS, Salesforce, Nextdoor, Pendo, and IDEO. She sits on company Boards and advises startups and investment funds. Tatyana has won many awards for her work and holds several technology & design patents. She has a PhD in economic anthropology from UC Berkeley and a BA in economics from Amherst College. She is a refugee from Ukraine and currently lives with her spouse and daughters in San Francisco.

â€‹Dr. Zafer Sahinoglu
General Manager
Mitsubishi Electric Innovation Center (MELIC Ventures)

â€‹Dr. Zafer Sahinoglu is currently the General Manager of Mitsubishi Electric Innovation Center (MELIC Ventures), which was launched in April 2020 as the innovation and investment arm of Mitsubishi Electric in North America. He is also serving as VP Innovation at Mitsubishi Electric US (MEUS). In MEUS, he has developed and launched SaaS businesses and new products in the fields of energy management, infrastructure monitoring, touchless interfaces, connected vehicles. He has led and managed product design and agile product development, built new business models, developed technology strategies, and bundled these steps into customized processes with continuous innovation.

â€‹Zafer was a senior principal research scientist in MERL between 2001 and 2016. In his MERL years, he was an inventor on more than 80 patents, co-authored more than 100 international journal and conference papers, made more than 50 key contributions to international standards including ZigBee, IEEE 802.15.4a UWB PHY and MAC, IEEE 802.15.4e MAC, and MPEG 21. His technical expertise includes deep learning, stochastic signal processing, space-time adaptive processing, ultra-wideband and OFDMA wireless communications, and indoor localization and tracking, biomedical signal processing, and Li-ion battery modeling. He has written two books on wireless communication and localization systems published by Cambridge University Press.

â€‹Zafer received his M.Sc. degree in Biomedical Engineering, Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering from New Jersey Institute of Technology, Newark, NJ, in years 2002 and 1998, respectively; and M.B.A. degree from Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 2013

â€‹Tomaz Suklje
Co-Founder and CEO
Nordoon

â€‹Tom is the Co-founder and Co-CEO of Nordoon, a company building AI Agents to automate and optimize non-EDI transactions across supply chains. With over eight years of experience in founding and leading B2B product companies, Tom is passionate about creating innovative solutions that deliver rapid, long-lasting value to stakeholders in manufacturing, logistics, and transportation

â€‹Tom holds a PhD in Mechanical Engineering and has lectured at academic institutions including MIT. Prior to Nordoon, he held leadership roles such as CRO at Qlector, CEO & Cofounder of Senzemo, and Co-founder of AgriSense.

â€‹Frode L. Odegard
Founder and CEO
Post-Industrial Institute

â€‹Frode is the founder of the Post-Industrial Institute, an independent research organization developing strategy and tools for the organizations of the future.

â€‹Frode founded his first startup in high school in Norway, M2CS, which built a next-generation development environment for embedded systems programming. He joined an ISO standards committee for the Modula-2 programming language while still in his teens, and served on the board of the Sun Microsystems User Group as the European representative soon after.

â€‹Frode immigrated to Silicon Valley in the early 1990s and founded an independent R&D lab, Odegard Labs, which worked with enterprise customers to solve difficult problems in software architecture, quality, and reengineering. Odegard Labs also did pathbreaking work in formal methods and language design.

â€‹In 2004 Frode founded the Post-Industrial Institute, with the mission to develop a new school of management science for the post-industrial era. In 2019 he also founded the Post-Industrial Forum, a community for visionary leaders building the organizations of the future.

event_name: LLM Orchestration â€” The Next Big Wave?
event_summary: This exclusive investor workshop explores the burgeoning field of LLM orchestration, a key driver of growth for companies like Cursor and Lovable,  uncovering untapped investment opportunities in this rapidly evolving AI sector.  The event features expert insights, interactive sessions, and networking with leading figures in the AI investment community.
full_address: Frontier Tower | Berlinhouse, 995 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
event_description:
â€‹This is an investor-only event.

â€‹Decipher the emerging technology wave powering todayâ€™s fastest-growing companies, like Cursor and Lovable. LLM orchestration is set to be the next significant hub of value creation after recent breakthroughs in base LLM models. Although this space already generates immense value, it remains largely untapped and under-discussed beyond tech circles.

â€‹This interactive workshop â€” combining presentation, Q&A, and live experimentation â€” will provide you clarity on what LLM orchestration is precisely about, and how to recognize early, promising patterns for your investment portfolio.

â€‹We'll also explore related topics, including the strategic rationale behind OpenAIâ€™s acquisition interest in Windsurf, reasons computer-generated intelligence continues accelerating despite slower progress in base LLM performance, and many more.

â€‹This workshop requires no technical background, only a good intuition about the AI tech startup ecosystem.

â€‹This event is hosted by Raeeza Tameez (VP @ Leo Capital), Lila Rest (CEO @ Life.js), and Anis Cheriet (Member @ Berlinhouse).

â€‹Timeline:

â€‹4:00-4:30pm: Arrival

â€‹4:30-6:00pm: Workshop

â€‹6:00-7:00pm: Networking
